Reviews.Title: “Really good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: eIaine
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in various hotels all over Sydney, and this is one of the best places for the price range. Sydney hotels/motels are expensive, and our rate for a queen room was very good. Room is basic but clean. Bed is on wheels and rolls around easily, but that is a really minor thing. Receptionist was very friendly. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Would be great if it were a little bit cleaner”
Reviews.Author: bmcant
Reviews.Content: A good three star hotel with excellent service. Free parking is provided which is rare close to Sydney city center. The motel about 20 minutes by bus from the central station during night time. It is 500m from Summer Hill train station. Be ware that not all trains stop at this station, but we found the frequency (Approx once in 15min at most times) to be fairly decent. The beds and furniture was good for a three star place. The room had a air conditioner, bar fridge, TV, tea/coffee making facilities, decent bathroom accessories (much more than what you would expect from this class). The premises was very secure. My review would have been far far better if we had not had a little bit of damp smell and a cockroach in our room. We had to keep the windows open due to the smell. The staff said that the cockroach might have come in as a result of that. Never the less, the lady at the counter was extremely cooperative. We were shown another alternate room but it seemed to have a bit of cigarette smell. She offered a full refund if we wanted to move out the next day. Given that there were few economical options close to the city, and we were going to be out of the motel most of the times, we decided just to stay on.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value!”
Reviews.Author: jimw48
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Marco Polo several times over 5 or 6 years, this time had 2 rooms for large family group. The service and quality are consistent and good value. Rooms are quite spacious, and comfortable, ideal place to leave the car and catch the city bus across the road. I'll go back there next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “perfectlocationinsydney.”
Reviews.Author: rainbowelmos
Reviews.Content: Sydney, Australia's most populated city, the largest of all, the one I couldn't wait to visit. We finally found the motel which we booked due on recommendation. The rooms were a pain to get to, they were upstairs, but it was quite worth it. The price was affordable and the rooms quite small, but most of our stay at Sydney would involve driving everywhere, so the rooms didn't contribute much to our stay... However, the beds were clean, there was free Foxtel, the kids absolutely loved it. Would consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Ok unless you mind bed bugs...”
Reviews.Author: BlackRocker
Reviews.Content: Traveling with three kids we just needed a cheap base close to Sydney CBD to explore the city the next day. We found Marco Polo on booking.com and paid $142 for a room that more or less fitted the five of us. This review would have been a lot more positive (i.e. mentioning the friendly staff) had I not woken up to find two big bed bugs that had dinner and breakfast on my expense. Their (my) blood is now staining the floor but despite the sweet revenge I felt yucky all day. So: Marco Polo is a cheap motel and it would be cheerful if it wasn't for the little suckers...

Reviews.Title: “7 nights great value no serious issues”
Reviews.Author: hologramqueen
Reviews.Content: stayed from the 26th nov to the 3rd Dec. when we finally arrived in our humongous Kluger (I think by toyota) I pulled into reception park in front of the security gate.. OK, so I had read the previous reviews prior to booking and looked at the candid photos, looks a bit scary.. Sharon is the owner, is kind, caring, personable, accommodating and genuine! Paid $1,000aud for a 7 night stay family of 4. The Aria awards were Sunday and there was some car show going on so they were booked up. first issue, my Mum is elderly and not very mobile, I thought that the room would be on the 2nd floor where the car park is.. oops, that's rooms in the 100's ours was in the 200's. OK, I knew in advance there wasn't a lift. we managed the stairs with her, slow but we managed. Then when we got to our sleeps 4 family room, the floors were tile and freshly mopped.. generally not an issue, but freshly mopped tile? makes the floors slippery and with an elderly Mum susceptible to falls, not going to work.. so down I went to Sharon in reception, she switched our room without hesitation from a sleeps 4 to a sleeps 5 which has carpet! Albeit old, but it had carpet.. While it was old, it was not dingy or dirty. just old as in outdated. There isn't smoking inside the rooms, but they do have ash&butt receptacles in the hall ways. Even though it is listed as a non smoking property. At night the guests were either sitting in the doorways, or out at the ends of the walkways. Noise.. We didn't encounter much as the walls are brick which attribute to their statement of soundproof walls.. we brought ear plugs per the suggestion in the review from "CozyPrincess" but never used them. They started some refurbishing while we were there but we were never inconvenienced by it. security: the fact that you can't get into the property without a keycard is a good thing. there is a motel across the street and down a bit that is open.. I remarked to my daughters that I wouldn't want to stay there because of that reason. There isnt much noise from the neighbors on the back or side. so that was good. Being there with my elderly Mum, 20 year old and 16 year old daughters and being somewhat of a fraidy cat (silly sounding I know, but I'm protective) I felt very safe during our entire stay. the laundry is on the ground floor and the only negative is the steam in the room when the dryer is on.. there are 2 washers and one dryer. ironing board and iron (also in your room) the cost to wash is $3 and to dry is $2. we used 2 washers (25 minute cycle) and 1 dryer (says 25 minutes to dry but actually was 40 minutes) and had to do another dry cycle since we had 2 loads in the one dryer.. but it was really fine. Parking: there is limited parking spaces on the 2nd level. and boy are they narrow! I had a toyota Kluger and had to either take 2 spaces, park along the wall or take the far end space, tuck in the mirrors, have everyone get out from one side and pray that I could get back out when I had to leave.. so, compact car would be the choice but we had a wheel chair to deal with. OH, and there aren't family rooms on the 1st level, only 2nd.. Beds were very comfortable. I don't usually sleep well in hotel or motel beds. but I was actually finding myself sleeping quite well and rested! Mattresses were firm but not overtly firm.. practically perfect! And they were not your average cheap 4-5" thick, they were acually quite nice and about 10-12" thick and quilted top. at least in our room they were. bedside reading lights on the queen bed were a nice touch. Phone didn't work, was always blinking but didn't matter we had our own phones. We had plenty of room in the fridge for soda's, and frozen foods. they have cutlery, plates, mugs, glasses and washing soap for the dishes. coffee, tea, hot cocoa, cream and sugar.. Microwave, hot pot & toaster. now the bathroom............ The sink was a nice new pedestal style sink. did I mention the sink was nice? ~~giggles~~ the bathroom leaves very little to be desired. The shower stall is very small and very small....only good thing about the shower was the water pressure and temperature of the water. But again, it is very small.. The toilet is literally right next to the glass of the shower stall and made for some very interesting acrobatics for cleansing. (not trying to be gross, just trying to give you a realistic idea) and I'm 5'6,140lbs... Brought a small can of lysol, sprayed (just for my own piece of mind, I do this when I stay at any hotel) the shower floor, toilet, sink, beds(comforter, pillows etc) door knobs, light switches and basically any touchable surface including the tile floor.. germs are germs, and when you're staying in ANY hotel, you need to stay safe... Having lived in a dorm during my college years, when I travel I always wear flipflops (shower shoes) in a hotel shower.. did the blacklight patrol on the floors, beds & bathroom... no stains or discoloration anywhere.. (I'm in hotels quite alot) there is a drying line if you have some wet clothes. out of the 8 days, only 1 day room wasn't made up and that is because we left late and they didnt come back I guess.. but Sharon had it taken care of. Location was brilliant but getting to the other side of the road in a car required going around the block. didn't take the bus but it was across the street and didn't pay attention if there was a stop out front or not. no restaurant, that would have been really good. good value for the money, clean comfortable room, nice beds, good amenities, safe and secure feeling, wireless internet wasn't too slow which was a plus. daughter was video chatting with her boyfriend and was "kicked" off a couple times but overall was good for everything we were online for(directions, time's etc) no printer and printer in reception does not work. you could email item to Sharon and she would then print it out for you. pay phone in reception area too.. had to only give it 4/5 on serivce since they forgot our room one time.. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value option if you want to park and ride!”
Reviews.Author: NodrogSouthAustralia
Reviews.Content: As this is a budget priced option, I didn't have high expectations. Street appeal is poor, not helped by the "drive through" window at the entrance and the massive sliding gate to the car park. The reception area was open so it it wasn't necessary to use the drive through, and staff were very warm and welcoming. Beyond the previously mentioned gate is a secure car park, so I left my car there during my two day visit and used public transport, which is only a short walk away. I would have saved most of the cost of the motel by avoiding car parking charges in Sydney's CBD, never mind the avoided stress. The rooms are basic, but functional and clean, with cable TV. Towels were plentiful and basic tolietries supplied.It was generally quiet, but there appears to be some renovation going on at present, with drilling noises from about 7.30 am. Overall, this was a reasonably good experience, and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Scary on the outside, safe and comfortable on the inside”
Reviews.Author: si_vorny
Reviews.Content: Pulled up to the Marco Polo thinking, what have we done. The bars on reception also didn't give me confidence but once inside the gates the rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable and have everything you need to stay the night. One of the cheapest places I found to stay in Sydney with free parking and free internet which was a plus. The only minus was that the pipes decided to make a song and dance in the morning, which I guess was one of our neighbours having a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to train”
Reviews.Author: 17larry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found it to be quite adequate. It is an older motel, but quiet and very clean and well maintained. Friendly, helpful staff. This is a good place if you want to park your car and use public transportation. Bus out front and train a short 3 block walk. Several restaurants and a grocery store near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Passible if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: allinam
Reviews.Content: Good location but not all trains stop at Summer Hill, Ashfield a better option. Noisy from 7.30 am as cleaners call out from one end to the other which carries up the building. No traffic noise but planes fly directly overhead in certain conditions. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms average but not too much attention to cleanliness ( mouldy tiles in bathroom ). Good facilities in rooms including microwave, toaster, etc. Free secure parking a bonus. Try negotiating rates as I got the impression they vary.

Reviews.Title: “Old but clean”
Reviews.Author: lindaprior
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the train station and the price. PROS: Clean room, lots of "free" toiletries, friendly owner, free parking, easy safe walk to leichhardt shopping area (cafes, italian shops), close to city, microwave& dishes in room, free newspapers, close to convenience stores and fast food. CONS: old and dated furniture & decor, noisy neighbours (aircon blocked mostly) NB we have a full size car and thought the car park was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodated our needs”
Reviews.Author: Thompson20
Reviews.Content: Reasonale price. Limited space but manageable. Very good security & clean. Staff very helpful. Owners Kiwi born from Te Kuiti in New Zealand. Thanks Diane.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: Maree19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for as we went to the AC/DC concert at ANZ stadium. It was clean, close to public transport and didn't cost too much, off street parking was secure and FREE! I found the check in staff to be very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but dont try too sleep in.”
Reviews.Author: 3Lechacal3
Reviews.Content: 8th time staying at the Marco Polo. This time was a little different as the room i was given had just been used by a 1 or 2 hour rental. You get the drift. I have had other issues before, but they are just standard motel issues. The main problem is the nonsense carried on by the room cleaners from 7.30am onwards. These people need to understand that not all people wish to be awake by this time. This has happened each time. No response from management. Noise goes on all night. Road noise is minimal. Rooms are well priced though as free wireless, a microwave and free pay tv are bonus's not usually associated with this price range. The motel is very close to sydney city (7km). All in all good value, but dont expect a peaceful sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small rooms. Noisy traffic and other guests. VERY small limited parking spaces.”
Reviews.Author: whatithink0
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were quite clean, they were very small. The parking spaces are very small - I had to get my passenger and bags out of the car before I squeezed my car into the last remaining car space. There are no lifts, and we had to cart our bags up two flights of stairs to our room. If you accidentally drive past the entrance, you have to go quite a way before you can turn around and get back to the motel - which you then have to drive past again, because you cant make a right hand turn into the place. The motel claims it has sound-proofed rooms - I found this not to be the case; unfortunately you could hear the traffic 24/7, and we didnt get a good nights sleep. There were a few asian families staying here and their kids were running up and down the outdoor corridors (yelling and being loud - like kids are), and this wasnt appreciated quite early in the morning. The lady at reception was very friendly and welcoming. The complimentary newspaper and biscuits were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Great Motel and Parking Tight”
Reviews.Author: ToniBee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2010 whilst attending AC/DC concert up the rd at Olympic Park Anz Stadium. We only stayed here as accomodation close to the venue was scarce and this was the closest we could find to the Olympic Park. I seriously would not pick this motel through choice and if I had read the reviews here I would definatly have gone somewhere else. There was a touch screen check in outside the office which was closed. The rooms were smelly and dirty with age and was just as others here have described lots of dodgy people and no questions's asked. Parking was very tight and difficult, I would definatly not recommend staying here at all unless u are very desperate.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: juzcrap
Reviews.Content: i sent an email enquiry and made a booking for a room for 4 at marco polo inn. replies were prompt with rates and details about room configuration and availability. i thus decided to go ahead with the room booking. i got an email reply saying "no problem, your booking is confirmed." i sent a mail back asking if any further particulars was needed to secure the booking and did not get any replies. a few days later, i emailed the inn again to 'reconfirm' my booking. again, i got the reply "no problem, your booking is confirmed." i printed the email conversation and went on my trip. on the day of check-in, together with my family, we arrived at the motel only to be shown a shocked look on the inn-keeper's face telling us that she had not noted or registered our booking and therefore.. there were no beds/room for us! a lesson to learn here is, never accept or trust a sentence of confirmation. the inn-keeper here has proven to be unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dannyboy215
Reviews.Content: Value for money with a good location close to cbd and great for people on a budget.Room was very clean and serviced daily which some hotels dont do and you pay alot more!!.Friendly people only negative is very tight parking.

Reviews.Title: “If you saw the front building, yet still paid your $$ & complained afterwards, who really is to blame?”
Reviews.Author: Genghis_Kwan
Reviews.Content: The Marco Polo Motor Inn is the kind of dodgy place where they go to film movies about dodgy motels. Someone should nominate this place for cultural heritage listing because places like this should not be allowed to disappear. Im not talking about your average Indian back alley garbage heap or budget south-east Asian shoebox, this is a genuine 80â€™s stereotype motel full of the dodgy characters that you would expect to see filing out from an 1980â€™s Hollywood movie set. On my numerous visits here Iâ€™ve seen shady figures of every kind from dirty old men, crusty pros, dodgy Lebs, loud Chinese grandmothers, 10 Indians sleeping in a room, cheating middle-aged housewives, wannabe business men, penny-pinching backpackers, try hards driving BMWâ€™s & your assortment of tourists. Almost everyone here seems to be sneaking around with some sort of secret, which makes for colourful speculation after hours. Itâ€™s the sort of place where no one asks any questions & you are left to your own business which suits me fine. Now the place is old & was in need of refurbishment 20 years ago. The carpet has a deep stale tobacco smell & is notably stained to show its age. The blinds in half the rooms hang off broken hooks & the mattresses were probably purchased from some Indian backpacker joint in Bombay, maybe thats too harsh. The 80â€™s style furniture is worn out in some rooms & ok in others so its pot luck, but you get free cable TV & Fox Sports! Some TVâ€™s are 51cms, but the Foxtel eases the pain considerably in my opinion especially if you came here by choice. This motel would not seem too out of place in Kuta Bali or any backpacker hole in Asia, its not terrible but its cheap & hey, at least your in Sydney & its not a bad place to be at least. Norton St in Leichhardt or little Italy is about 15 mins walk & the Annandale Hotel, one of the best live band hotels is about 2kms down Parramatta Rd. If your from overseas or crazy, try walking all the way to the City along Parramatta road, it might take 2 hours but theres no shortage of shops, resturants & pubs. If a gun wasnâ€™t put to your head to stay here then you shouldnâ€™t really complain, if you are a tourist & found yourself here, be thankful its relatively cheap in Sydney & if you just happen to be ignorant & stayed here thinking it would be decent & it wrecked your day, bad luck to you, seriously. I used to stay here to crash with some mates after a night out on the town to watch the soccer & EPL live on Fox Sports, drink beer & smoke until 6am. The TV is small & the rooms tiny but if your not with good company & your miserable, then maybe its not the room thatâ€™s the problem.

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: brewer582001
Reviews.Content: On arrival checked in and went to room. The room was more like a cell than a room; The toilet was dirty, the shower had ancient hair in the corners, three drawers were so filthy that nothing could have been put in them, and the chairs had at least 5yrs fluff, grease and grime on the level bits. One curtain was hanging off the rail and the bed sheet was an unhealthy shade of grey. The bed smelt damp and dirty. There was no way we could have spent anytime in this room, so we returned to reception and checked out. .
